title: Compilation of rust-0.11.0 with rust-0.11 compiler fails with src/libcore/ops.rs:576:58: 576:66 error: mismatched types: expected `uint` but found `u8`
body:
I'm trying to compile the rust-0.11.0 from the source tarball  http://static.rust-lang.org/dist/rust-0.11.0.tar.gz using http://static.rust-lang.org/dist/rust-0.11.0-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu.tar.gz.

It fails with errors.

Last part of log:

'''
MKDIR:     /var/tmp/portage/dev-lang/rust-0.11.0/work/rust-0.11.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/rt/compiler-rt/triple/builtins
  FINAL-ARCHIVE: triple/builtins: /var/tmp/portage/dev-lang/rust-0.11.0/work/rust-0.11.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/rt/compiler-rt/triple/builtins/libcompiler_rt.a
make[1]: Leaving directory `/var/tmp/portage/dev-lang/rust-0.11.0/work/rust-0.11.0/src/compiler-rt'
cp: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libcompiler-rt.a
rustc: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libcore
/var/tmp/portage/dev-lang/rust-0.11.0/work/rust-0.11.0/src/libcore/ops.rs:576:58: 576:66 error: mismatched types: expected`uint`but found`u8`(expected uint but found u8)
/var/tmp/portage/dev-lang/rust-0.11.0/work/rust-0.11.0/src/libcore/ops.rs:576             fn shl(&self, other: &$t) -> $t { (*self) << (*other) }
                                                                                                                                       ^~~~~~~~
/var/tmp/portage/dev-lang/rust-0.11.0/work/rust-0.11.0/src/libcore/ops.rs:571:1: 586:2 note: in expansion of shl_impl!

/var/tmp/portage/dev-lang/rust-0.11.0/work/rust-0.11.0/src/libcore/ops.rs:576             fn shl(&self, other: &$t) -> $t { (*self) << (*other) }
                                                                                                                                       ^~~~~~~~
